intro: Penicillaria doche, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive blue or violet flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has slender, trailing stems that can grow up to several meters in length, often climbing or creeping along the ground. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers have five petals that open sequentially. Penicillaria doche is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with deep root systems that help it access water from underground sources.
